greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fill the plane with the square spiral with cells numbered as in A275609; sequence gives the cells along the East spoke starting at the origin.
comment: The Example section of A275609 shows the central portion of the spiral very clearly. The link below shows a larger portion but is harder to read.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000

N. J. A. Sloane, Central portion of spiral, shown without spaces [The central 0 (at (0,0)) has been changed to an X. The illustration shows cells (x,y) with -35 <= x <= 35, -33 <= y <= 36.] The present sequence gives the numbers to the East of the X.
xref: The eight spokes starting at the origin are A307193 - A307200.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 29 2019
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 30 2019
